name: cushaw
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a type of squash (= a large vegetable with a hard skin and a lot of seeds at its centre) with a long, curved neck: Beans, cushaw, and summer squashes grow well here, but not winter squash like pumpkins. They ate boiled beef, baked cushaws and bread. Pumpkins and cushaw squash are my absolute favorites.
More examplesFewer examplesOne large cushaw provides enough squash to prepare several different dishes.When baked, the cushaw is tender and moist.The young cushaws are boiled, and seasoned with salt and mint. Here are some ways you can use cushaw squash.The cushaw pumpkin has been long been cultivated for its edible fruit.
